sense.name: make or produce products in quantity, perhaps in a mechanical way.
sense.examples: Most memory chips are now manufactured overseas. The costs of manufacturing clothing domestically have gone up in recent years. That firm manufactures about a dozen brands of cereal. The Hollywood writers seem to manufacture the scripts for these sitcoms. (metaphoric extension) This novelist has been manufacturing his books following his initial success.

sense.name: think up a falsehood, concoct a lie
sense.examples: They claim the teenager manufactured the story just to get attention. The state-controlled press manufactures far-fetched justifications for the dictator's atrocities. The scientist confessed that he had manufactured most of the results in his experiments.

sense.name: Produce naturally.
sense.examples: This gland manufactures a specific substance only. Maple trees manufacture delicious sap.
